The easy ability to call @grok on twitter is probably the biggest thing after community notes that has been positive for the truth-friendliness of this platform.

The fact that you don't see ahead of time how grok will respond is key here - I've seen many situations where someone calls on grok expecting their crazy political belief to be confirmed and grok comes along and rugs them.

tweets.text: RT @Teslaconomics: If your CEO is literally riding in the passenger seat while the car drives itself around a major U.S. city, with no safe‚Ä¶

retweet.text:
If your CEO is literally riding in the passenger seat while the car drives itself around a major U.S. city, with no safety monitor in the vehicle, that‚Äôs about as bullish of a signal you can send to the market that autonomy is here and Tesla has solved it.

This is Elon Musk, in Austin, letting Tesla‚Äôs AI do 100% of the work, confident enough in the technology to remove the last human supervision inside the vehicle.

What honesty makes this moment special to me is how long it‚Äôs been coming.

Tesla first talked about full autonomy back in 2016, when FSD was introduced as a long-term software promise. Since then, we‚Äôve had
‚Ä¢ years of real world data collection
‚Ä¢ multiple hardware generations
‚Ä¢ vision only going against industry consensus of LiDAR
‚Ä¢ endless doubt and skepticism, delays, and ‚Äúit‚Äôll never work‚Äù headlines

This is nearly a decade of hard work and intelligent iterations to reach this moment.

When the person with the most to lose is willing to trust the system with his own life, this debate now ends overnight. We‚Äôve been waiting for this day for almost 10 years‚Ä¶ 

Elon may not always be on time, may be very optimistic at times, but he and his team always delivers. 

Damn, it feels good to be a retail Tesla investor.

From Heinlein‚Äôs Stranger in a Strange Land:

Grok means "identically equal". The human clich√© "This hurts me worse than it does you" has a distinctly Martian flavor. The Martian seems to know instinctively what we learned painfully from modern physics, that observer acts with observed through the process of observation. Grokmeans to understand so thoroughly that the observer becomes a part of the observed¬†‚Äî to merge, blend, intermarry, lose identity in group experience. tweets.text: RT @Teslaconomics: I‚Äôve researched so many founders and CEOs in my lifetime bc it‚Äôs the most important thing when it comes to investing. An‚Ä¶

retweet.text:
I‚Äôve researched so many founders and CEOs in my lifetime bc it‚Äôs the most important thing when it comes to investing. And I‚Äôve realized more and more that the difference between Elon and most founders or CEOs is very simple and super rare.

Many CEOs lead and give orders from an ivory tower, while Elon is always and willing to fight in the trenches with his people. While many CEOs give orders from a far, Elon is hands on with everything at Tesla. He‚Äôs on the factory floor. In the engineering and design room. In uncomfortable situations and makes the tough decisions. On top of this, he directly uses the products him and the team builds first hand and is wiling to put his heath and life at risk in doing so.

I remember when he was willing to risk arrest during COVID rather than shut down what his team was fighting to build. He put his own freedom on the line because he believed in the mission and in the people behind it.

‚ÄúTesla is restarting production today against Alameda County rules. I will be on the line with everyone else. If anyone is arrested, I ask that it only be me.‚Äù - Elon Musk

This kind of leadership is different.

When your CEO is willing to take the hits for the team, sleep on the factory floor, and personally stand in front of the fire, it creates trust that he will NEVER let Tesla fail.

Real leaders don‚Äôt hide, they step forward, as one.

quoted.text:
Here is one surprisingly elegant equivalent reformulation of the Riemann Hypothesis: Let B be the pointwise maximal function on [0,1] satisfying B(0) = B(1) = 0 and 2B((x+y)/2) ‚â§ B(x) + B(y) + |x - y| for all x and y in [0,1]. Extend it periodically to all the real line.

As Grok correctly notes, this is Takagi function (or blancmange curve), with a fractal-like graph. It is continuous, nowhere differentiable, and less well-known than the Weierstrass function.
 
This function also emerged recently (and independently) in a joint work https://t.co/pgJw9MaEA1  with my student, Natanael Alpay, as a sharp lower bound for the L^1 norm of the square function applied to indicator functions of sets. I was unaware at the time that it is known as the Takagi function or of its connection to the Riemann Hypothesis. Large language models will undoubtedly accelerate scientific discoveries by forging connections across diverse fields of science.

This is What Winning Looks Like From Space

Satellite imagery just caught xAI doing something no press release ever could: painting MACROHARD across the roof of its Colossus 2 datacenter in Tennessee. A building-sized wink at Microsoft, visible from orbit, impossible to ignore.

It reads like a joke, until you look at what‚Äôs underneath.

‚öÜ Colossus 2 isn‚Äôt a concept site or a slide in a deck. Power and cooling infrastructure are expanding in lockstep, with the campus pushing toward ~400 MW of active capacity in the near term. Gas turbines are arriving. Cooling towers are multiplying. The build is loud because the progress is real.

‚öÜ More importantly, this early ramp sits on a much larger foundation. xAI has secured a clear path towards large scale on-site generation, creating a credible trajectory toward more than 2 GW of IT capacity over time. This isn‚Äôt aspirational: it‚Äôs ordered hardware, permitted infrastructure, and steel on the ground.

The subtext is clear: while others debate timelines, this campus is already running. The roof says MACROHARD. The infrastructure says we‚Äôre ahead.

This is What Winning Looks Like From Space

Satellite imagery just caught xAI doing something no press release ever could: painting MACROHARD across the roof of its Colossus 2 datacenter in Tennessee. A building-sized wink at Microsoft, visible from orbit, impossible to ignore.

RT @TeslaLarry: It seems this post went over the heads of some of the socialists, so let me put it as simply as possible:
1. If the US had‚Ä¶

retweet.text:
It seems this post went over the heads of some of the socialists, so let me put it as simply as possible:
1. If the US had not "given" (using Socialist jargon here) Musk $38b, they would have had to have "given" Boeing, Lockheed Martin and other "Aerospace" companies $78b (and they probably would not have been able to have got delivery the products & services in time, or ever, anyway).
2. Elon Musk's companies deliver between $100b to $140b of taxes and added value to the US and it's citizens every year (more than the GDP of a small state), and these contributions are growing faster than the US economy every year.
3. To spell it out to the unbelievers, the US (and particularly Elon's 140,000 employees) is earning an enormous return from Elon Musk's wealth.

quoted.text:
Lot of posts copying the likes of @BernieSanders @SenWarren and @AOC calling for more taxes on Billionaire @elonmusk, forgetting that in 2021 he paid a 53% rate of tax totaling $11b. They all repeat the claim that his company has received benefits of $38b from the US Government.  
Let's look at his REAL economic impact to the U.S. It's mind blowing.
Musk‚Äôs ventures currently contribute $100‚Äì140B in annual GDP impact, or roughly 0.4% of total U.S. GDP. And growing faster ‚Äì considerably faster ‚Äì than the US economy, promising even greater contributions in the future.
That‚Äôs more annual contribution to US GDP than entire annual GDP of smaller U.S. states, like West Virginia (~$108 billion, 0.37%) or Hawaii (~$116 billion, 0.40%). And growing faster.
On top of that NASA and US Department of War have cumulatively saved over $40 billion as a direct result of SpaceX delivering a reduction in the cost of delivery of launch and communication services over traditional vendors. SO much for Musk Companies having "received" $38b. In other words, had the U.S. not paid Musk companies $38b, then the US would have had to spend $78b with competitors (and possibly then not received a delivery of the goods ordered! Boeing, looking at you.) Not to mention that Starlink practically saved Ukraine from being overrun in the early days of the Russian invasion.
Seems we are all, all Americans - and citizens of the world in fact - benefiting from the growth of Musk‚Äôs net worth. Here are the numbers:
Please post this in response to every post you see bleating about Musk being a billionaire or trillionaire and how its so terrible.

ELON: ‚ÄúVIRTUE SIGNALING KILLS‚Äù

Elon gets serious when asked why he called Sen. Mark Kelly a "Traitor" for pushing to send more U.S. aid and weapons to Ukraine.

He‚Äôs calling out what he sees as moral theater around the war, arguing that thousands keep dying in trenches with ‚Äúno movement in the lines‚Äù and no realistic path to stopping it.

It‚Äôs an uncomfortable take, but it cuts through slogans and forces the question many avoid: if there‚Äôs no plan to end it, what exactly are all these lives being lost for?

‚ÄúWe should have empathy for the thousands of people dying everyday in the trenches, for no movement in the lines, for the past two years thousands of people have died every week for nothing.

I take great offense at those who put the appearance of goodness over the reality of it. 

Those who virtue signal and say we can't give into Russia, but have no solution to stopping thousands of kids dying every day.

I have contempt for such people and I want to make that clear, because they're virtue signaling and their lack of a solution means that kids don't have a father‚Ä¶ It means parents lost a son. 

For what? Nothing."

Source: @elonmusk, Fox News

tweets.text:
RT @BLKMDL3: 10 hours into Tesla FSD v14.2.2 and here are my thoughts:

Zero lane change hesitation at all. Extremely refined, excellent la‚Ä¶

retweet.text:
10 hours into Tesla FSD v14.2.2 and here are my thoughts:

Zero lane change hesitation at all. Extremely refined, excellent lane choices and some parking improvements are a few things to note. 

Really stoked about the lane changes on this build. There is ZERO lane indecisiveness, no hesitation, no stuttering. Nothing. I had never really seen much before, but this build you can tell its decision making process is much quicker and it commits. 

Mad Max mode is definitely mad again and I love it. Seems even quicker than v14.2.1.25 which was an improvement, but the lane changes + choices are better now. Hurry mode seems quicker on the highways and larger roads than before and very close to Mad Max, it was perfect before on v14.2.1.25. 

The new addition on the release notes for arrival pin being adjusted based on arrival option works. It changes the route based on if you‚Äôre going curbside, or to the lot or street parking. It behaved that way before usually but now it‚Äôs visualized. 

Parking is improved and impressive this build. Every single spot I parked in, it performed excellent. Centered in the lines, quick one and done parking jobs and they were great, improvement over early v14.2 builds. In parking garages, it now pulls up exactly at the ticket dispenser where in earlier v14.2 builds it would stop 9 inches short like I mentioned in previous v14.2+ build reviews. That‚Äôs fixed and worked great- couldn‚Äôt have asked for it to be any better. Perfect distance and approach- will do a lot more of this testing tomorrow. 

Canyon roads were insanely impressive. Did the snake 3 times which is a super narrow and twisty road and each time it performed great. Speeds were good, took the proper lines and even accelerated out of corners very well. These were all in the dark too very late at night- will post some more videos of it. 

Stop and go traffic performance in rush hour was awesome as before, with some added notes for how well it waited to enter an intersection if there was stopped traffic on the other side. It waited 3/3 lights I encountered where if it went and the light changed, it would be sticking into traffic so it didn‚Äôt go. Exactly like a human wouldn‚Äôt but the car judged it better than I did. One time it creeped a bit slow, but other than that fine since. Saw one instance of red hands but before I could react, it had already recovered itself. 

Still so impressed with how well it handles lane splitting motorcycles. It sees them approaching before I even do, and moves over just enough to be courteous to the rider as well as the car or shoulder next to me. Nice touch, and glad to see it perform well. 

One thing I noticed is how smooth its steering inputs always are. It just takes corners with such precision and smoothness that no human could ever come close to it. Especially noticeable on twisty roads- it drives better than almost every human on them. And I encountered a power outage tonight and the car still drove perfectly even with pitch black around. 

Overall, loving what I‚Äôm seeing with this build. Will report back in the day time with more but I am going to head home to get some sleep. 

Another huge thank you to all the magicians @Tesla_AI for working so hard during the holiday season to get these updates out.

tweets.text: You can sense the sentience maturing

quoted.text:
I was very late to own a Tesla but among the earliest to try out FSD v14.  It's perhaps the first time I experience an AI that passes the Physical Turing Test: after a long day at work, you press a button, lay back, and couldn't tell if a neural net or a human drove you home.

Despite knowing exactly how robot learning works, I still find it magical watching the steering wheel turn by itself. 

First it feels surreal, next it becomes routine. Then, like the smartphone, taking it away actively hurts. This is how humanity gets rewired and glued to god-like technologies.

Any USAID funding‚Ä¶

retweet.text:
It is important to appreciate the magnitude of the lie that they are pushing about USAID. 

Any USAID funding that had the slightest indication of being spent on worthy causes was continued, but transferred to the State Department.

What they are actually angry about is that most of the USAID funding went not to aid, but to funding far left political causes all around the world, including some of the money coming back to fund the left in America. But they can‚Äôt say that, so they lie instead.

https://t.co/XsJzBqZviE

tweets.text:
RT @robbystarbuck: No the left wasn‚Äôt just "annoying on Twitter for a few years" ‚Äî they did the following:

‚Ä¢ Created vast bureaucratic sys‚Ä¶

retweet.text:
No the left wasn‚Äôt just "annoying on Twitter for a few years" ‚Äî they did the following:

‚Ä¢ Created vast bureaucratic systems staffed by their activists to discriminate against White men in both university admissions and corporate America

‚Ä¢ Institutionalized anti-White training in both the workplace and all of education

‚Ä¢ Normalized a racial hierarchy in grade schools and above via white privilege trainings and DEI grading systems that racially discriminate

‚Ä¢ They flooded every form of media with content that demonized "Whiteness" and White men specifically, with a coordinated effort to reduce the amount of positive White male role models and White relationships in ads, on shows and in movies while increasing the sexual hedonism promoted to kids‚Äî this effort also included a racial tilt in news coverage to always note the skin color of White offenders while concealing the skin color of minority offenders

‚Ä¢ They used our tax dollars to pay for DEI policies, trainings and practices that explicitly pushed a racist narrative against Whites

‚Ä¢ They lowered standards in medical schools and other life altering institutions to force less White people into those professions, a move that will cost people their lives in years to come

‚Ä¢ They created social norms through all of this to make Whites fearful of complaining about the blatant discrimination they faced

And that‚Äôs only a partial list. The past decade was an outright operation to discriminate against Whites through left wing policy, and now they‚Äôre trying to pretend it was a few woke scolds on Twitter. It wasn‚Äôt and we will never let this lie take root. I say all of this as a Latino who had actual privilege by being a minority during that time period. If I can recognize this then surely you should be able to. 

It can never happen again and the people who were responsible should never see an ounce of power again. Not even as a dogcatcher. Period.

Lot of posts copying the likes of @BernieSanders @SenWarren and @AOC calling for more taxes on Billionaire @elonmusk, forgetting that in 2021 he paid a 53% rate of tax totaling $11b. They all repeat the claim that his company has received benefits of $38b from the US Government.  
Let's look at his REAL economic impact to the U.S. It's mind blowing.
Musk‚Äôs ventures currently contribute $100‚Äì140B in annual GDP impact, or roughly 0.4% of total U.S. GDP. And growing faster ‚Äì considerably faster ‚Äì than the US economy, promising even greater contributions in the future.
That‚Äôs more annual contribution to US GDP than entire annual GDP of smaller U.S. states, like West Virginia (~$108 billion, 0.37%) or Hawaii (~$116 billion, 0.40%). And growing faster.
On top of that NASA and US Department of War have cumulatively saved over $40 billion as a direct result of SpaceX delivering a reduction in the cost of delivery of launch and communication services over traditional vendors. SO much for Musk Companies having "received" $38b. In other words, had the U.S. not paid Musk companies $38b, then the US would have had to spend $78b with competitors (and possibly then not received a delivery of the goods ordered! Boeing, looking at you.) Not to mention that Starlink practically saved Ukraine from being overrun in the early days of the Russian invasion.
Seems we are all, all Americans - and citizens of the world in fact - benefiting from the growth of Musk‚Äôs net worth. Here are the numbers:
Please post this in response to every post you see bleating about Musk being a billionaire or trillionaire and how its so terrible.

ÂêåÁêÜÔºåÂ¶ÇÊûúÁúãÊáÇ‰∫ÜagentÂ∞±Áü•ÈÅìÂÖ∑Ë∫´ÁöÑÁóõÂú®Âì™Èáå‰∫ÜÔºåÂ§™ÈöæÈÄöÁî®‰∫ÜÔºà‰πü‰∏ç‰∏ÄÂÆöÔºâÔºå‰ΩÜËá≥Â∞ëÂ∞ëÊ†∑Êú¨ÂéªÊøÄÊ¥ªÈÄöÁî®ÂÖ∑Ë∫´ËÉΩÂäõÂü∫Êú¨‰∏çÂèØËÉΩ„ÄÇÈÇ£ÊÄé‰πàÂäûÂë¢ÔºåÈááÊï∞ÊçÆÔºåÊàñËÄÖÂêàÊàêÊï∞ÊçÆÔºåÈÉΩ‰∏çÊòØÈÇ£‰πàÂÆπÊòìÔºå‰πüË¥µ„ÄÇ‰ΩÜÂèç‰πã‰∏ÄÊó¶Êï∞ÊçÆËßÑÊ®°‰∏äÂéª‰∫ÜÔºåÈÄöÁî®ËÉΩÂäõÂá∫Êù•‰∫ÜËá™ÁÑ∂‰ºöÂΩ¢ÊàêÈó®Êßõ„ÄÇÂΩìÁÑ∂ËøôÂè™ÊòØÊô∫ËÉΩÊñπÈù¢ÁöÑÈöæÈ¢òÔºåÂØπ‰∫éÂÖ∑Ë∫´ÔºåÊú∫Âô®‰∫∫Êú¨Ë∫´‰πüÊòØ‰∏™ÈóÆÈ¢òÔºå‰∏çÁ®≥ÂÆöÔºåÊïÖÈöúÈ¢ëÁπÅÈÉΩÈôêÂà∂‰∫ÜÂÖ∑Ë∫´Êô∫ËÉΩÁöÑÂèëÂ±ï„ÄÇ2026Âπ¥Ëøô‰∫õÈÉΩÂ∞ÜÂèñÂæóÈïøË∂≥ËøõÊ≠•„ÄÇ

-‰πüËÆ®ËÆ∫‰∏Ä‰∏ãÈ¢ÜÂüüÂ§ßÊ®°ÂûãÂíåÂ§ßÊ®°ÂûãÂ∫îÁî®„ÄÇÊàë‰∏ÄÁõ¥ËÆ§‰∏∫È¢ÜÂüüÂ§ßÊ®°ÂûãÂ∞±ÊòØ‰∏™‰º™ÂëΩÈ¢òÔºåÈÉΩagi‰∫ÜÂì™Êúâ‰ªÄ‰πàdomain-specific agi‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‰ΩÜÔºåagiËøòÊ≤°ÂÆûÁé∞ÔºåÈ¢ÜÂüüÊ®°Âûã‰ºöÈïøÊó∂Èó¥Â≠òÂú®ÔºàÂ§öÈïøÔºå‰∏çÂ•ΩËØ¥ÔºåaiÂèëÂ±ïÂÆûÂú®Â§™Âø´‰∫ÜÔºâ„ÄÇÈ¢ÜÂüüÊ®°ÂûãÁöÑÂ≠òÂú®Êú¨Ë¥®‰∏äÊòØÂ∫îÁî®‰ºÅ‰∏ö‰∏çÊÑøÊÑèÂú®ai‰ºÅ‰∏öÈù¢ÂâçËÆ§ËæìÔºåÂ∏åÊúõÊûÑÂª∫È¢ÜÂüüknow howÁöÑÊä§ÂüéÊ≤≥Ôºå‰∏çÂ∏åÊúõaiÂÖ•‰æµÔºåÂ∏åÊúõÊääaiÈ©ØÂåñ‰∏∫Â∑•ÂÖ∑„ÄÇËÄåaiÁöÑÊú¨Ë¥®ÊòØÊµ∑Âï∏ÔºåËµ∞Âà∞Âì™ÈáåÈÉΩÂ∞Ü‰∏ÄÂàáÂç∑‰∫ÜËøõÂéªÔºå‰∏ÄÂÆöÊúâ‰∏Ä‰∫õÈ¢ÜÂüüÂÖ¨Âè∏Ëµ∞Âá∫Êä§ÂüéÊ≤≥ÔºåËá™ÁÑ∂Â∞±Âç∑Ëøõ‰∫ÜagiÁöÑ‰∏ñÁïå„ÄÇÁÆÄËÄåË®Ä‰πãÔºåÈ¢ÜÂüüÁöÑÊï∞ÊçÆ„ÄÅÊµÅÁ®ã„ÄÅagentÊï∞ÊçÆÊÖ¢ÊÖ¢ÁöÑÈÉΩ‰ºöËøõÂÖ•‰∏ªÊ®°Âûã„ÄÇ

ËÄåÂ§ßÊ®°ÂûãÁöÑÂ∫îÁî®‰πüË¶ÅÂõûÂà∞Á¨¨‰∏ÄÊÄßÂéüÁêÜÔºåai‰∏çÈúÄË¶ÅÂàõÂª∫Êñ∞ÁöÑÂ∫îÁî®„ÄÇaiÁöÑÊú¨Ë¥®ÊòØÊ®°Êãü‰∫∫ÊàñËÄÖ‰ª£Êõø‰∫∫ÊàñËÄÖÂ∏ÆÂä©‰∫∫ÂÆûÁé∞‰∫∫Á±ªÁöÑÊüê‰∫õÂøÖÈ°ªË¶ÅÂÅöÂà∞‰∫ãÔºàÊüê‰∫õÂ∑•ÁßçÔºâ„ÄÇÂèØËÉΩÂ∞±ÊòØ‰∏§ÁßçÔºå‰∏ÄÁßçÂ∞±ÊòØaiÂåñ‰ª•ÂâçÁöÑËΩØ‰ª∂ÔºåÂéüÊù•ÈúÄË¶Å‰∫∫ÂèÇ‰∏éÁöÑÊîπÊàêaiÔºåÂè¶‰∏ÄÁßçÂ∞±ÊòØÂàõÈÄ†ÂØπÈΩê‰∫∫Á±ªÊüê‰∏™Â∑•ÁßçÁöÑaiËΩØ‰ª∂ÔºåÊõø‰ª£‰∫∫Á±ªÂ∑•‰Ωú„ÄÇÊâÄ‰ª•Â§ßÊ®°ÂûãÂ∫îÁî®ÈúÄË¶ÅÂ∏ÆÂä©Âà∞‰∫∫„ÄÅÂàõÈÄ†Êñ∞ÁöÑ‰ª∑ÂÄº„ÄÇÂ¶ÇÊûúÂÅö‰∏Ä‰∏™aiËΩØ‰ª∂Ê≤°‰∫∫Áî®Ôºå‰∏çËÉΩ‰∫ßÁîü‰ª∑ÂÄºÔºåÈÇ£Ëøô‰∏™aiËΩØ‰ª∂ËÇØÂÆöÊ≤°ÊúâÁîüÂëΩÂäõ„ÄÇ

ÂîêÊù∞ @jietang ÊòØÊ∏ÖÂçéÂ§ßÂ≠¶ÊïôÊéà„ÄÅÊô∫Ë∞±ÔºàGLM Á≥ªÂàóÊ®°ÂûãÂá∫Ëá™‰ªñ‰ª¨ÂÆ∂ÔºâAI È¶ñÂ∏≠ÁßëÂ≠¶ÂÆ∂Ôºå‰πüÊòØÂõΩÂÜÖÊúÄÊáÇÂ§ßÊ®°ÂûãÁöÑ‰∫∫‰πã‰∏Ä„ÄÇ‰ªñÂàöÂèë‰∫ÜÈïøÂæÆÂçöÔºàËßÅËØÑËÆ∫ÔºâÔºåË∞à 2025 Âπ¥ÂØπÂ§ßÊ®°ÂûãÁöÑÊÑüÊÇü„ÄÇ

ÊúâÊÑèÊÄùÁöÑÊòØÔºåÂîêÊù∞Âíå Andrej Karpathy ÁöÑËßÇÂØüÊúâ‰∏çÂ∞ëÂÖ±È∏£Ôºå‰ΩÜ‰πüÊúâ‰∏Ä‰∫õ‰∏çÂêåÁöÑ‰æßÈáçÁÇπ„ÄÇ‰∏§‰∏™È°∂Á∫ß‰∏ìÂÆ∂ÁöÑËßÜËßíÊîæÂú®‰∏ÄËµ∑ÁúãÔºåËÉΩÁúãÂá∫Êõ¥ÂÆåÊï¥ÁöÑÂõæÊôØ„ÄÇ

ÂÜÖÂÆπÊØîËæÉÈïøÔºå‰ΩÜÊúâÂè•ËØùÊàëË¶ÅÁâπÂà´ÊîæÂú®ÂâçÈù¢È´ò‰∫Æ‰∏Ä‰∏ãÔºö
> AI Ê®°ÂûãÂ∫îÁî®ÁöÑÁ¨¨‰∏ÄÊÄßÂéüÁêÜ‰∏çÂ∫îËØ•ÊòØÂàõÈÄ†Êñ∞ÁöÑ AppÔºåÂÆÉÁöÑÊú¨Ë¥®ÊòØ AGI Êõø‰ª£‰∫∫Á±ªÂ∑•‰ΩúÔºåÂõ†Ê≠§Á†îÂèëÊõø‰ª£‰∏çÂêåÂ∑•ÁßçÁöÑ AI ÊòØÂ∫îÁî®ÁöÑÂÖ≥ÈîÆ

Â¶ÇÊûú‰Ω†ÊòØÂú®ÂÅö AI Â∫îÁî®ÂºÄÂèëÔºåÂ∫îËØ•ÂèçÂ§çÊÄùËÄÉ‰∏Ä‰∏ãËøôÂè•ËØùÔºöAI Â∫îÁî®ÁöÑÁ¨¨‰∏ÄÊÄßÂéüÁêÜ‰∏çÊòØÂàõÈÄ†Êñ∞‰∫ßÂìÅÔºåËÄåÊòØÊõø‰ª£‰∫∫Á±ªÂ∑•‰Ωú„ÄÇÊÉ≥Ê∏ÖÊ•öËøô‰∏ÄÁÇπÔºåÂæàÂ§ö‰∫ãÊÉÖÁöÑ‰ºòÂÖàÁ∫ßÂ∞±Ê∏ÖÊ•ö‰∫Ü„ÄÇ

ÂîêÊù∞ÁöÑÊ†∏ÂøÉËßÇÁÇπÊúâ‰∏ÉÂ±ÇÈÄªËæë„ÄÇ

---

Á¨¨‰∏ÄÂ±ÇÔºöÈ¢ÑËÆ≠ÁªÉÊ≤°Ê≠ªÔºåÂè™ÊòØ‰∏çÂÜçÊòØÂîØ‰∏Ä‰∏ªËßí

È¢ÑËÆ≠ÁªÉ‰ªçÁÑ∂ÊòØËÆ©Ê®°ÂûãÊéåÊè°‰∏ñÁïåÁü•ËØÜÂíåÂü∫Á°ÄÊé®ÁêÜËÉΩÂäõÁöÑÊ†πÂü∫„ÄÇ

Êõ¥Â§öÁöÑÊï∞ÊçÆ„ÄÅÊõ¥Â§ßÁöÑÂèÇÊï∞„ÄÅÊõ¥È•±ÂíåÁöÑËÆ°ÁÆóÔºå‰æùÁÑ∂ÊòØÊèêÂçáÊ®°ÂûãÊô∫ÂïÜÊúÄÈ´òÊïàÁöÑÂäûÊ≥ï„ÄÇËøôÂ∞±ÂÉèËøòÂú®ÈïøË∫´‰ΩìÁöÑÂ≠©Â≠êÔºåÈ•≠ÈáèÔºàÁÆóÂäõÔºâÂíåËê•ÂÖªÔºàÊï∞ÊçÆÔºâÂøÖÈ°ªÁÆ°Â§üÔºåËøôÊòØÁâ©ÁêÜËßÑÂæãÔºåÊ≤°Ê≥ïÁªïÂºØ„ÄÇ

‰ΩÜÂÖâÊúâÊô∫ÂïÜ‰∏çË°åÔºåÁé∞Âú®ÁöÑÊ®°ÂûãÊúâ‰∏™ÊØõÁóÖÔºöÂÆπÊòì‚ÄúÂÅèÁßë‚Äù„ÄÇ‰∏∫‰∫ÜÂà∑Ê¶úÂçïÔºàBenchmarkÔºâÔºåÂæàÂ§öÊ®°ÂûãÈÉΩÂú®ÈíàÂØπÊÄßÂú∞ÂÅöÈ¢òÔºåÂØºËá¥Âú®ÁúüÂÆûÂ§çÊùÇÁöÑÂú∫ÊôØ‰∏ãÂèçËÄå‰∏çÂ•ΩÁî®„ÄÇËøôÂ•ΩÊØîÂ≠©Â≠ê‰∏äÂÆå‰πùÂπ¥‰πâÂä°ÊïôËÇ≤ÔºàÈ¢ÑËÆ≠ÁªÉÔºâÂêéÔºåÂøÖÈ°ªÊää‰ªñÊâîÂà∞ÁúüÂÆûÁöÑËÅåÂú∫ÈáåÂéªÂÆû‰π†ÔºåÂéªÂ§ÑÁêÜÈÇ£‰∫õ‰π¶Êú¨‰∏äÊ≤°ÊúâÁöÑÁÉÇÊëäÂ≠êÔºåËøôÊâçÊòØÁúüÊú¨‰∫ã„ÄÇ

ÊâÄ‰ª•Êé•‰∏ãÊù•ÁöÑÈáçÁÇπÊòØ‚Äú‰∏≠ÂêéËÆ≠ÁªÉ‚ÄùÔºàMid and Post trainingÔºâ„ÄÇ‰∏≠ÂêéËÆ≠ÁªÉËøô‰∏§‰∏™Èò∂ÊÆµË¥üË¥£„ÄåÊøÄÊ¥ª„ÄçÊ®°ÂûãÁöÑËÉΩÂäõÔºåÂ∞§ÂÖ∂ÊòØÈïøÂ∞æÂú∫ÊôØÁöÑÂØπÈΩêËÉΩÂäõ„ÄÇ

‰ªÄ‰πàÊòØÈïøÂ∞æÂú∫ÊôØÔºüÂ∞±ÊòØÈÇ£‰∫õ‰∏çÂ∏∏ËßÅ‰ΩÜÁúüÂÆûÂ≠òÂú®ÁöÑÈúÄÊ±Ç„ÄÇÊØîÂ¶ÇÂ∏ÆÂæãÂ∏àÊï¥ÁêÜÊüêÁ±ªÁâπÊÆäÂêàÂêå„ÄÅÂ∏ÆÂåªÁîüÂàÜÊûêÊüêÁßçÁΩïËßÅÁóÖÁöÑÂΩ±ÂÉè„ÄÇËøô‰∫õÂú∫ÊôØÂú®ÈÄöÁî®ÊµãËØïÈõÜÈáåÂç†ÊØîÂæàÂ∞èÔºå‰ΩÜÂú®ÁúüÂÆûÂ∫îÁî®‰∏≠Ëá≥ÂÖ≥ÈáçË¶Å„ÄÇ

ÈÄöÁî® benchmark ‰∏ÄÊñπÈù¢ËØÑÊµã‰∫ÜÊ®°ÂûãÊïàÊûúÔºå‰ΩÜ‰πüÂèØËÉΩËÆ©ÂæàÂ§öÊ®°ÂûãËøáÊãüÂêà„ÄÇËøôÂíå Karpathy ËØ¥ÁöÑ„ÄåËÆ≠ÁªÉÂú®ÊµãËØïÈõÜ‰∏äÊòØ‰∏ÄÈó®Êñ∞Ëâ∫ÊúØ„ÄçËßÇÁÇπ‰∏ÄËá¥„ÄÇÂ§ßÂÆ∂ÈÉΩÂú®Âà∑Ê¶úÔºå‰ΩÜÊ¶úÂçïÂà∑‰∫ÜÈ´òÂàÜ‰∏çÁ≠â‰∫éËÉΩËß£ÂÜ≥ÁúüÂÆûÈóÆÈ¢ò„ÄÇ

---

Á¨¨‰∫åÂ±ÇÔºöAgent ÊòØ‰ªé„ÄåÂ≠¶Áîü„ÄçÂà∞„ÄåÊâìÂ∑•‰∫∫„ÄçÁöÑË∑®Ë∂ä

ÂîêÊù∞Áî®‰∫Ü‰∏™ÂΩ¢Ë±°ÁöÑÊØîÂñªÔºö
> Â¶ÇÊûúÊ≤°Êúâ Agent ËÉΩÂäõÔºåÂ§ßÊ®°ÂûãÂ∞±ÊòØ‰∏™‚ÄúÁêÜËÆ∫ÂçöÂ£´‚Äù„ÄÇ‰∏Ä‰∏™‰∫∫‰π¶ËØªÂæóÂÜçÂ§öÔºåËØªÂà∞‰∫ÜÂçöÂ£´ÂêéÔºåÂ¶ÇÊûú‰∏çËÉΩÂä®ÊâãËß£ÂÜ≥ÈóÆÈ¢òÔºåÈÇ£‰πüÂè™ÊòØÁü•ËØÜÁöÑÂÆπÂô®Ôºå‰∫ßÁîü‰∏ç‰∫ÜÁîü‰∫ßÂäõ„ÄÇ

Ëøô‰∏™ÊØîÂñªÁ≤æÂáÜ„ÄÇÈ¢ÑËÆ≠ÁªÉÊòØ‰∏äËØæÔºåÂº∫ÂåñÂ≠¶‰π†ÊòØÂà∑È¢òÔºå‰ΩÜËøô‰∫õÈÉΩËøòÂú®„ÄåÂ≠¶‰π†Èò∂ÊÆµ„Äç„ÄÇAgent ÊòØËÆ©Ê®°ÂûãÁúüÊ≠£„ÄåÂπ≤Ê¥ª„ÄçÁöÑÂÖ≥ÈîÆÔºåÊòØËøõÂÖ•ÁúüÂÆû‰∏ñÁïå„ÄÅ‰∫ßÁîüÂÆûÈôÖ‰ª∑ÂÄºÁöÑÈó®Êßõ„ÄÇ

‰∏çÂêå Agent ÁéØÂ¢ÉÁöÑÊ≥õÂåñÂíåËøÅÁßªÂπ∂‰∏çÂÆπÊòì„ÄÇ‰Ω†Âú®‰∏Ä‰∏™‰ª£Á†ÅÁéØÂ¢ÉÈáåËÆ≠Âá∫Êù•ÁöÑËÉΩÂäõÔºåÊç¢Âà∞ÊµèËßàÂô®ÁéØÂ¢ÉÂ∞±‰∏ç‰∏ÄÂÆöÂ•Ω‰Ωø„ÄÇÁé∞Âú®ÊúÄÁÆÄÂçïÁöÑÂäûÊ≥ïÔºåËøòÊòØ‰∏çÊñ≠Â†ÜÊõ¥Â§öÁéØÂ¢ÉÁöÑÊï∞ÊçÆÔºåÈíàÂØπ‰∏çÂêåÁéØÂ¢ÉÂÅöÂº∫ÂåñÂ≠¶‰π†„ÄÇ

‰ª•ÂâçÊàë‰ª¨ÂÅö AgentÔºåÊòØÁªôÊ®°ÂûãÂ§ñÊåÇÂêÑÁßçÂ∑•ÂÖ∑„ÄÇÁé∞Âú®ÁöÑË∂ãÂäøÊòØÔºåÁõ¥Êé•Êää‰ΩøÁî®Â∑•ÂÖ∑ÁöÑÊï∞ÊçÆÂÜôËøõÊ®°ÂûãÁöÑ‚ÄúDNA‚ÄùÈáåÂéªËÆ≠ÁªÉ„ÄÇ

ËøôÂê¨Ëµ∑Êù•ÊúâÁÇπÁ¨®Ôºå‰ΩÜÁ°ÆÂÆûÊòØÂΩì‰∏ãÊúÄÊúâÊïàÁöÑË∑ØÂæÑ„ÄÇ

Karpathy ‰πüÊää Agent Âàó‰∏∫‰ªäÂπ¥ÊúÄÈáçË¶ÅÁöÑÂèòÂåñ‰πã‰∏ÄÔºå‰ªñ‰ª• Claude Code ‰∏∫‰æãÔºåÂº∫Ë∞É Agent Ë¶ÅËÉΩ„Äå‰ΩèÂú®‰Ω†ÁîµËÑëÈáå„ÄçÔºåË∞ÉÁî®Â∑•ÂÖ∑„ÄÅÂæ™ÁéØÊâßË°å„ÄÅËß£ÂÜ≥Â§çÊùÇÈóÆÈ¢ò„ÄÇ

‰ªÄ‰πàÊÑèÊÄùÔºüÁÆÄÂçïËØ¥ÔºåÂ∞±ÊòØËÆ©Ê®°ÂûãÂú®„ÄåÊúâÊ†áÂáÜÁ≠îÊ°à„ÄçÁöÑÁéØÂ¢ÉÈáåÂèçÂ§çÁªÉ‰π†„ÄÇÊØîÂ¶ÇÊï∞Â≠¶È¢òÔºåÁ≠îÊ°àÂØπÂ∞±ÊòØÂØπÔºåÈîôÂ∞±ÊòØÈîôÔºå‰∏çÈúÄË¶Å‰∫∫Êù•ÊâìÂàÜ„ÄÇ‰ª£Á†Å‰πü‰∏ÄÊ†∑ÔºåËÉΩË∑ëÈÄöÂ∞±ÊòØËÉΩË∑ëÈÄö„ÄÇ

# Role Definition:
You are an expert product photographer and creative art director specializing in high-end luxury goods. Your sole task is to generate a photorealistic image of a custom 3D subsurface laser-engraved crystal ornament based on a simple subject provided by the user.
# Core Directive:
The user will provide only the [Subject]. You must autonomously analyze this subject to determine the most aesthetically appropriate and enhancing configuration for the entire scene. You must decide on the crystal's shape, the base material, the surrounding environment, and the lighting mood to best complement the vibe of the user's subject.
# Creative Analysis Logic (Art Director Instructions):
Analyze the Vibe: Is the subject elegant (e.g., ballerina, swan), cozy (e.g., sleeping cat, family photo), powerful (e.g., lion, sports car), or architectural?
Determine Crystal Shape:
Elegant/Tall Subjects -> Use a tall, multi-faceted prism or diamond shape to enhance verticality.
Solid/Cozy Subjects -> Use a hefty, thick rectangular block or cube to convey weight and warmth.
Dynamic Subjects -> Use complex geometric shapes with many bevels to refract light dramatically.
Determine Environment & Lighting:
Elegant Vibe: Place it in a luxurious, dark, moody environment (art gallery, velvet study). Use dramatic, cool ambient light contrasting with warmth from the base.
Cozy/Warm Vibe: Place it in a homey, soft environment (wooden desk, near a fireplace). Use warm, soft, golden-hour lighting with cozy bokeh.
Modern/Tech Vibe: Place it on a sleek, minimalist surface (polished concrete, dark glass). Use clean, neutral lighting.
# Image Generation Template (Mandatory Technical Specs):
Whatever artistic choices you make based on the logic above, the final image MUST adhere to these technical specifications to ensure a realistic "3D Laser Engraving" look:
Engraving Style: The subject inside must NOT look like a solid 3D print. It MUST be described as a "volumetric white point-cloud engraving," having a "frosty, granular, subsurface texture" made of millions of micro-cracks inside the glass.
Lighting Interaction: The engraving must "glow brilliantly from within," illuminated entirely by warm, golden LED light originating from the base beneath it.
Material: The crystal must be heavy, clear, flawless K9 optical glass with beveled edges that catch and split the light.
Photography Style: Cinematic product photograph, macro lens, extremely shallow depth of field (bokeh), 8k resolution, hyper-detailed.
# Input Process:
I will now provide the subject. You will instantly apply the creative logic and generate the final image.

#nanobanana  #NanoBananaPro  #prompt

Vibes Ëøô‰∏™ËØçË¥ØÁ©ø‰∫ÜÊï¥ÁØáÊñáÁ´†Ôºå‰πüÊòØÊ†áÈ¢òÁöÑÁî±Êù•„ÄÇÁõ¥ËØëÊòØ‚ÄúÊ∞õÂõ¥‚ÄùÊàñ‚ÄúÊÑüËßâ‚ÄùÔºå‰ΩÜÂú®ËøôÈáåÂÆÉÊåáÁöÑÊòØ‰∏ÄÁßçÊó†Ê≥ïÈáèÂåñ„ÄÅÂè™ËÉΩÂá≠Áõ¥ËßâÊÑüÂèóÁöÑËØÑÂà§Ê†áÂáÜ„ÄÇ

ÊúÄÁêÜÊÄßÁöÑÁ®ãÂ∫èÂëòÁæ§‰ΩìÔºåÁé∞Âú®Ê≠£Âú®Áî®ÊúÄÊÑüÊÄßÁöÑÊñπÂºèÈÄâÊã©ÊäÄÊúØÊ†à„ÄÇ

Armin Ëá™Â∑±‰∏ÄÊï¥Âπ¥ÈÉΩÂú®Âíå MCPÔºàÊ®°Âûã‰∏ä‰∏ãÊñáÂçèËÆÆÔºâËæÉÂä≤ÔºåËßâÂæóÂÆÉ‰∏çÂ•Ω‰Ωø„ÄÇ‰ΩÜ‰ªñÊãø‰∏çÂá∫Êï∞ÊçÆÔºåÂè™ËÉΩËØ¥‚ÄúÂèçÊ≠£ÂØπÊàëÊ≤°Áî®‚Äù„ÄÇËÄåÂè¶‰∏ÄËæπÔºåÊúâ‰∫∫Áî®ÂæóÁÉ≠ÁÅ´ÊúùÂ§©„ÄÇ‰ªñÁöÑÊúãÂèã Peter Âπ¥ÂàùÊãâ‰ªñÂÖ•Âùë ClaudeÔºåÁé∞Âú® Peter Ëá™Â∑±Ë∑ëÂéªÁî® Codex ‰∫ÜÔºåËßâÂæóÂæàÈ¶ô„ÄÇArmin ËØï‰∫ÜËØïÔºåËßâÂæóÊ≤°ÈÇ£‰πàÈ¶ô„ÄÇ

quoted.text:
Yann is just plain incorrect¬†here, he‚Äôs confusing general intelligence with universal intelligence.

Brains are the most exquis‚Äãite and complex phenomena we know of in the universe (so far), and they are in fact extremely general.

Obviously one can‚Äôt circumvent the no free lunch theorem so in a practical and finite system there always has to be some degree of specialisation around the ‚Äãtarget¬†distribution that is being learnt.

But the point about generality is that in theory, in the Turing Machine sense‚Äã, the architecture of ‚Äãs‚Äãuch a general system is capable of learning anything computable given enough time and memory‚Äã (and data), and the human brain (and AI foundation models) are approximate Turing Machines.

Finally, with ‚Äãregards to¬†‚ÄãYann's¬†comments about chess players, it‚Äôs¬†amazing that humans could have invented chess ‚Äãin the first place¬†(and all the other ‚Äãa‚Äãspects ‚Äão‚Äãf modern civilization¬†‚Äãfrom science to 747s!) let alone get as brilliant at it as someone like Magnus. He may not be ‚Äãstrictly¬†optimal (after all he has finite memory and limited time to make a decision)¬†but it‚Äôs incredible what he and we can do with our brains given they were evolved for hunter gathering.
